From: Nawal Mohammad <Nawal.Mohammad@loccitane.me> 
Sent: Thursday, 17 April 2025 4:06 PM
To: Vic Eldrin Munar <Vic.Munar@gig-gulf.com>; Wilson Moraise <Wilson.Moraise@chalhoub.com>; Abdulrahim Alblooshi <Abdulrahim.Alblooshi@gig-gulf.com>; Marine Cargo Claims <marinecargo.claims@gig-gulf.com>; PATHAK Prakash <Prakash.Pathak@chalhoub.com>
Cc: Raima Raman <Raima.Raman@chalhoub.com>; One Reach <OneReach@chalhoub.com>; local shipping <local.shipping@chalhoub.com>
Subject: Re: Request for Nawal Mohammad : 20. Logistics Complaints - [#SR-1143684] Appointment Number 0000136812 / Claim Ref # 412/CC25/235 GIG CLIM : 23/MO/17683

 

CAUTION: External Email. Do not click links or open attachments unless this email comes from a known sender and you know the content is safe.

 

Hi Vic,

 

Please see below my comments in Red,

 

*	The Direct Delivery report indicates that the consignee is to receive 1,827 pieces, whereas the commercial invoice and packing list state that 2,753 pieces should be delivered. Please clarify this discrepancy.( The Commercial invoice states 2753 pieces, because it includes PLV's, paper bags, boxes etc. These items are not priced; hence, they are not added in the PO. Direct delivery report is shared based on the PO ).[GIG]  Noted

*	Incident Report: (The incident was reported from the store side, after all the packages were opened and scanned in the system. As soon as the discrepancies are recorded, the claim form is submitted for logistics to investigate.)

metadata.doc_id: CMZALDC - request for nawal mohammad 20. logistics complaints - appointment number 0000136812 claim\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CMZALDC - request for nawal mohammad 20. logistics complaints - appointment number 0000136812 claim\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
*	Incident Report: (The incident was reported from the store side, after all the packages were opened and scanned in the system. As soon as the discrepancies are recorded, the claim form is submitted for logistics to investigate.)

[GIG] It is essential to understand that Marine Insurance Policies only cover losses that occur during transit, not after it has ended. The insured is responsible for proving that the loss took place while the goods were in transit, by providing relevant evidence and documentation.

*	POD is not claused – (POD to stores is signed based on delivering the packages. The final count is confirmed once all the packages are opened and the products are scanned.

This shipment had 2000+ products, hence it is not practical for the delivery agent to wait until the scanning is completed.)

[GIG] We acknowledge that in certain situations, the POD may not be claused, as illustrated in your example above. In such cases, we expect the insured to take either of the following actions:

1.	Promptly inform the carriers and their agents of the loss – for Land Transit (within 24 hours from discovery), for Air Transit (within 14 days), for Sea Transit (within 3 days)
2.	If direct notification to the carriers is not possible, request the freight forwarders to issue a notice of loss to the carriers and ensure your team is copied on the communication.

 

Failure to take these actions may compromise our recovery rights, and we reserve the right to deduct the corresponding amount directly from the claim settlement.

chunks.text:
1.	Promptly inform the carriers and their agents of the loss – for Land Transit (within 24 hours from discovery), for Air Transit (within 14 days), for Sea Transit (within 3 days)
2.	If direct notification to the carriers is not possible, request the freight forwarders to issue a notice of loss to the carriers and ensure your team is copied on the communication.

 

Failure to take these actions may compromise our recovery rights, and we reserve the right to deduct the corresponding amount directly from the claim settlement.

 

Immediate notice of loss against carriers (or the local agents of the carriers). (Attached claim form shared as soon as product is scanned, and thr missing items are identified by the store team.)

[GIG] See above

 

Best Regards,

 

 

NAWAL MOHAMMAD​​​​

ASSOCIATE ‑ CUSTOMER SERVICE



 

________________________________

Dear Wilson,

 

Thanks for the documents.

 

Please share the following:

 

*	The Direct Delivery report indicates that the consignee is to receive 1,827 pieces, whereas the commercial invoice and packing list state that 2,753 pieces should be delivered. Please clarify this discrepancy.
*	Incident Report: Brief description of the incident clarifying when and where the loss was first noticed. 
*	POD is not claused – kindly clarify why?
*	Immediate notice of loss against carriers (or the local agents of the carriers) 

 

Kindly note that the above communication or requirements are not exhaustive. Issued on “without prejudice” basis.

 

Best Regards,

 

Vic Eldrin Munar

Non Motor Claims Manager (Property & Casualty)

Tel: (+971) 4 440 3759

P.O. Box 32505, Dubai – United Arab Emirates 

www.gig-gulf.com <https://url.uk.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/8O0ZC21LBTRkXGqC1hnc5-BaH?domain=gig-gulf.com/>

chunks.text:
CAUTION: This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe. 
تم إرسال هذا البريد الإلكتروني من خارج مجموعة شلهوب. لا تنقر على الروابط أو تفتح المرفقات إلا إذا كنت تعرف المرسل وتعلم أنه آمن

PUBLIC

 

Dear Wilson,

 

Thank you for the notification. 

We have registered the claim under reference 23/MO/17683

May we request for the following details: 

•                    Pre-shipment inspection report at the source of voyage (if applicable) 

•                    Photographs (at the time of loading at the source and at the time of offloading at the final destination) 

•                    Incident Report: Brief description of the incident clarifying when and where the loss was first noticed. 

•                    Weight slips from each source: from the source warehouse, source port, vessel (mate’s receipt), destination port and the destination warehouse. 

•                    Draft survey report- from source port and destination port (in case of bulk cargo) 

•                    Short landing certificate from concerned authority (police/ customs/ terminal operator/ stevedores etc.) 

•                    Customs Receipt - at source and destination 

•                    Immediate notice of loss against carriers (or the local agents of the carriers) 

•                    Immediate notice of loss against the suppliers (in case of shortage from sealed containers) 

•                    Details of contact person and location (if a Loss Adjuster is to be appointed)

metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CMZALDC - request for nawal mohammad 20. logistics complaints - appointment number 0000136812 claim\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
•                    Immediate notice of loss against the suppliers (in case of shortage from sealed containers) 

•                    Details of contact person and location (if a Loss Adjuster is to be appointed) 

•                    Claim Bill 

 

We look forward to hearing from you. 

Kindly note that the above communication or requirements are not exhaustive. Issued on a “without prejudice” basis.

 

 

Thanks & Regards,

Abdulrahim Alblooshi 

Non Motor Claims Executive (Property & Casualty)

Tel: (+971) 4 440 3792

P.O. Box 32505, Dubai – United Arab Emirates
